metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1999014 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FFmpeg before commit bab0716c7f4793ec42e05a5aa7e80d82a0dd4e75 contains an out of array access vulnerability in MXF format demuxer that can result in DoS. This attack appear to be exploitable via specially crafted MXF file which has to be provided as input. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in bab0716c7f4793ec42e05a5aa7e80d82a0dd4e75 and later.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1999014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.1-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.1-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.1-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.1-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.1-1
libavresample4 - 7:4.1-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.1-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.1-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.1-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.1-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> marking chromium-browser as ignored, since we do full-version updates, and rely on upstream's bundled ffmpeg version

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.1-1').
gst-libav1.0 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
kino package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
